newsitem.title: JAPAN: Real estate shares up on policy hopes.
newsitem.headline: Real estate shares up on policy hopes.

text.p: Real estate sector shares rallied in Friday morning trade, supported by renewed expectations that new policies to activate land transactions will be proposed later this year, traders said.
Shares of Mitsui Fudosan Co Ltd was up 30 yen at 1,520 yen at 0122 GMT. Turnover was 2.931 million shares, making it the third most heavily traded issue.

Mitsubishi Estate Co Ltd was up 20 yen at 1,540 yen, on volume of 1.255 million shares. Sumitomo Realty & Development Co Ltd was unchanged at 870 yen after rising briefly to 875 yen. Turnover was 761,000 shares.
Market hopes were reignited by a newspaper report on Friday saying that an advisory panel to the prime minister was likely to propose a review on the land taxation system by the end of November.

The stock market has been supported by underlying optimism that the Liberal Democratic Party will win Sunday's general election and create a stable government that will implement reforms of the taxation system smoothly, brokers said.
